snippet: Justice Antonin Scalia said on CNN that the Supreme Court’s bitterly divided decision upholding President Obama’s health care law had not led to a falling out with Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.
abstract: Justice Antonin Scalia, in CNN interview, says that the Supreme Court’s bitterly divided decision upholding the Affordable Care Act has not led to a falling out with Chief Justice John G Roberts Jr, who shocked many by joining the court's liberal wing in the decision.
lead_paragraph: Justice Antonin Scalia said on CNN that the Supreme Court’s bitterly divided decision upholding President Obama’s health care law had not led to a falling out with Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.

headline.seo: Justice Scalia Says He Had No ‘Falling Out’ With Chief Justice Roberts
headline.main: Scalia Says He Had No ‘Falling Out’ With Chief Justice
headline.print_headline: Scalia Says He Had No ‘Falling Out’ With Chief Justice
